cities.tip: ‚úàÔ∏è Don't Miss: Hop on the London Eye or stroll across the iconic Tower Bridge.
cities.fact: üìç Fun Fact: Did you know London is home to over 170 museums? Plus, Big Ben is actually the name of the bell, not the clock!

cities.tip: ‚úàÔ∏è Don't Miss: Enjoy the Eiffel Tower lit up at night and explore the Louvre.
cities.fact: üìç Fun Fact: Paris has more dogs than children! It's one of the most pet-friendly cities in the world.

cities.tip: ‚úàÔ∏è Don't Miss: Toss a coin in the Trevi Fountain to ensure your return to this eternal city.
cities.fact: üìç Fun Fact: Rome has over 2,000 fountains, including the iconic Trevi Fountain.

cities.tip: ‚úàÔ∏è Don't Miss: Stroll along Las Ramblas and explore Park G√ºell.
cities.fact: üìç Fun Fact: The Sagrada Familia has been under construction since 1882 and is still not finished!

cities.tip: ‚úàÔ∏è Don't Miss: Cruise along the famous canals by boat or bike.
cities.fact: üìç Fun Fact: There are more bicycles than people in Amsterdam!

cities.tip: ‚úàÔ∏è Don't Miss: Visit the Berlin Wall and the Reichstag.
cities.fact: üìç Fun Fact: Berlin‚Äôs nightlife lasts all weekend long, and the city is nine times bigger than Paris.

cities.tip: ‚úàÔ∏è Don't Miss: Take a gondola ride along the canals at sunset.
cities.fact: üìç Fun Fact: Venice has over 400 bridges, but only 4 cross the Grand Canal.

cities.tip: ‚úàÔ∏è Don't Miss: Relax in Retiro Park and visit the Royal Palace.
cities.fact: üìç Fun Fact: Madrid is home to the world‚Äôs oldest restaurant, Casa Bot√≠n, open since 1725.

cities.tip: ‚úàÔ∏è Don't Miss: Walk across the Charles Bridge and admire the Prague Castle.

cities.tip: ‚úàÔ∏è Don't Miss: Visit the Prater Park and try the famous Sachertorte at one of its historic caf√©s.
cities.fact: üìç Fun Fact: Vienna is known as the 'City of Music,' home to Mozart, Beethoven, and Schubert.

recommendations.title: London Eye
recommendations.description: It was worth the wait, it was my favorite view of London

recommendations.title: Tower of London
recommendations.description: A must-visit for history enthusiasts! The Crown Jewels and the medieval architecture made me feel like I was stepping back in time. Definitely recommend taking the guided tour to hear fascinating stories about the Tower's past.

recommendations.title: Sacr√© C≈ìur
recommendations.description: On my last day in Paris, this sunset will remain etched in my memory forever. In the plaza of the Sacr√©-C≈ìur Basilica, people sing and dance under a beautiful orange sky.

recommendations.title: Place du Tertre
recommendations.description: Strolling through Montmartre, I found myself in the lively Place du Tertre, where artists filled the square with color and creativity. I watched painters at work, each capturing the soul of Paris in their own style. It was a magical moment that felt like stepping into a postcard, one I‚Äôll never forget.

recommendations.title: Giardino degli Aranci
recommendations.description: I found this hidden gem in Rome called Giardino degli Aranci on Aventine Hill. It's so peaceful and has an incredible view of St. Peter‚Äôs Basilica, especially at sunset. Felt like I had the whole place to myself!

recommendations.title: Quartiere Copped√®
recommendations.description: Onmy trip to Rome I found this amazing corner,it's like stepping into a fairytale with its quirky, stunning architecture. No crowds, just a magical little neighborhood perfect for a quiet afternoon stroll.

recommendations.title: Da Enzo al 29 ristorante
recommendations.description: I discovered this amazing restaurant in Rome called Da Enzo al 29. It‚Äôs a cozy, family-run spot in Trastevere, and the food is incredible‚Äîauthentic Roman dishes like carbonara and cacio e pepe. The ingredients are super fresh, and the atmosphere feels like a true local experience. Make sure to try their tiramisu!

recommendations.title: A little oasis.
recommendations.description: I spent a lovely day strolling through the Tamarita Gardens, a hidden gem in Barcelona. The peaceful atmosphere, beautiful fountains, and lush greenery made it the perfect escape from the city's hustle. It‚Äôs an ideal spot to relax, unwind, and enjoy nature in the heart of the city.

recommendations.title: canal cruise at sunset.
recommendations.description: I took a canal cruise in Amsterdam at sunset, and it was absolutely magical. The way the golden light hit the water, reflecting off the old brick houses, made the whole city glow. Gliding through the canals felt peaceful, and passing by spots like the Anne Frank House and Westerkerk gave the ride a special touch. It was the perfect way to unwind and see Amsterdam from a completely different perspective!

recommendations.title: Konnopke‚Äôs Imbiss
recommendations.description: Located under the Eberswalder Stra√üe bridge, Konnopke‚Äôs Imbiss is one of Berlin‚Äôs most iconic spots to try the famous currywurst. With a history dating back to 1930, this family-run kiosk has been serving locals and tourists alike with their unique take on Berlin's signature street food. The combination of sausage, spicy ketchup, and curry powder makes for a quintessential Berlin experience.

recommendations.title: Gondola Ride through the Grand Canal
recommendations.description: Gliding through the serene waters of the Grand Canal in a gondola was like stepping into a dream. The historic palazzos on either side, the gentle sway of the boat, and the gondolier singing softly made the experience unforgettable. As the sun set, the city took on a golden glow, reflecting beautifully off the water.

recommendations.title: Sobrino de Bot√≠n
recommendations.description: In the heart of Madrid, Sobrino de Bot√≠n, recognized by the Guinness World Records as the oldest restaurant in the world, offers a truly unique dining experience. Famous for its roast suckling pig, each bite takes you on a journey through Madrid‚Äôs rich culinary tradition. The classic and cozy atmosphere transports you to another era, making it the perfect spot for an unforgettable meal.

recommendations.title: Walking Across Charles Bridge at Dawn
recommendations.description: Early in the morning, with a light mist still lingering over the Vltava River, I strolled across the Charles Bridge. The statues seemed to come alive in the soft light of dawn, and the view of the Prague Castle in the distance was breathtaking. It felt like I had the entire city to myself, a quiet and magical moment that I‚Äôll always cherish.

recommendations.title: Sch√∂nbrunn Palace
recommendations.description: Wandering through the gardens of Sch√∂nbrunn Palace, I was transported to a different era. The grandeur of the palace, combined with the serenity of the beautifully manicured gardens, made me feel like royalty. Watching the sunset over the Gloriette was the perfect way to end the day.
